8.heading: Schiaviato, Éric.
8.title: Les Prédateurs
8.author: Richelle ; encrages, Éric Schiavinato ; lettrage, Guy Buhry ; couleurs, Li Ge.
notes: (Les Coulisses du Pouvoir ; 8)
(Ligne Rouge)

Summary (from OCLC): Mettant en vedette le commandant Caine et l'inspecteur Burkinshaw de Scotland Yard, une série qui a pour thème la corruption politique et les crimes divers qu'elle provoque dans son sillage. Ce huitième tome clôt l'enquête entamée dans le volume précédent sur la mort d'un administrateur de sociétés immobilières qui se serait suicidé de "deux" balles dans la tête. Une excellente série qui met à jour les aspects douteux de la vie politique sous le couvert d'une intrigue policière rondement menée. Un scénario complexe et intelligent servi par une mise en images sans fioriture.

9.heading: Schiavo, Fabio, 1980-
9.title: The Beatles in Comic Strips
9.author: Enzo Gentile, Fabio Schiavo ; translations by Christopher Evans.
notes: English and some Italian; translated from the Italian.
"Includes exclusive double poster."

Summary: "This book for the first time investigates and documents the interest that The Beatles aroused among cartoonists, publishers, and enthusiasts, highlighting the Fab-Four's special relationship with the universe of comic strips; it is a rich and variegated relationship underpinned by thousands of publications in every part of the world, and a production that continues to the present day. Accompanying a selection of rare images that appeared in the most important magazines and newspapers, as well as examples unfamiliar even to experts on the subject, are a series of explanatory texts and a complete chronology of The Beatles"

24.heading: Schields, Gretchen.
24.title: Princess Sheegwa
24.author: by George Daugherty ; illustrations by Gretchen Schields ; based on the screenplay "Princess Sheegwa," written by Anne-Marie Perrota and Tean Schultz ; illustrations based on storyboards by Elie Klimos.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 23 cm.
"Sagwa, the Chinese Siamese Cat, is from the PBS KIDS series based on the book written by Amy Tan and illustrated by Gretchen Schields."

Summary (from OCLC): Everyone thinks Sagwa's little sister, Sheegwa, is a princess, and she's getting lots of attention. Sagwa is jealous, but she can't admit it until someone reminds her the new Princess Sheegwa may have to go far away to live. Suddenly Sagwa realizes she is going to miss her sister a lot. Can she make it up to Sheegwa before she leaves? And is there any way to keep her at home?

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): On the distant planet of Deloca, teenagers enroll in an education system like no other, a mobile journey that takes place onboard a train. There are standard School Trains for general studies, and then there's the Special Train, an exceptional institution whose students receive anything but a normal education. Reiichi is a student contented to obediently follow the tracks laid out before him, but when Arena, a rebellious girl with a mysterious past, enters the scene, his life is completely derailed. While dodging the persistent investigator after Arena, Reiichi and his unintended partner-in-crime experience a school year never to be forgotten.

241.heading: Schilling, Katherine.
241.title: Night of the Beasts
241.author: story and art by Chika Shiomi ; translation, Kathy Schilling ; adaptation, Jake Forbes.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): High school tough girl Aria is notorious for taking on her school's worst bullies. But punching out jerks is nothing compared to what happens when she finds herself inexplicably drawn to the demonically possessed Sakura, a guy who would as readily rip apart his own parents as seek her healing embrace. Sakura says Aria has the power to save him, but will she be able or even willing to?

is she right?
